statement:
Let $k$ be field, $V$ a vector space over $k$, $\dim V=n$, and
$T:V \to V$ a linear operator. Let $W$ be a subspace of $V$. And let
$v_{1},\ldots,v_{r} \in V$ such that
$W=Z(v_{1},T) \bigoplus \cdots \bigoplus Z(v_{r},T)$ (see the cyclic
subspace definition), and $(m_{v_{i}}, m_{v_{j}})=1$ if $i \neq j$,
where $m_{v}$ denotes the minimal polynomial of $v$ (or in other words,
its annihilator polynomial). Then,
$Z(v_{1}+\cdots+v_{r},T)=Z(v_{1},T) \bigoplus \cdots \bigoplus Z(v_{r}, T)$,
and $m_{v_{1}+ \cdots +v_{r}}=m_{v_{1}}  \cdots  m_{v_{r}}$.
